meanings.definition: To move or lift with a pulley.
meanings.sent1: She was pulleying the heavy box up to the attic.
meanings.sent2: The workers were pulleying the supplies to the top floor of the building.
meanings.sent3: The kids were pulleying their toys up the treehouse for a fun adventure.
meanings.sent4: His words were like pulleying my heart up to the clouds with joy.
meanings.sent5: The image of pulleying the boat onto the shore stayed in his mind.

meanings.definition: The act of using a pulley to lift or move something.
meanings.sent1: The pulleying of the piano was done carefully to avoid any damage.
meanings.sent2: We watched the smooth pulleying of the car engine into place.
meanings.sent3: The pulleying of the cat up the tree was quite a sight to see.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was like the pulleying of happiness into the room.
meanings.sent5: The pulleying of the curtains revealed a beautiful view of the garden.
